summary: The Cerebral Palsy Research Program Authorization Act of 2025 aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to carry out a program of research related to cerebral palsy. This includes research on diagnosis, treatment, prevalence mitigation, and associated healthcare costs. The bill also mandates public health surveillance, education, and training; provides for evaluations of the effectiveness of the program; and authorizes $5,000,000 in appropriations annually from 2026-2031 to support these initiatives.
